description: Macaws are large, brightly coloured parrots from Central and South America, known for loud calls and strong beaks.
They feed on fruit, nuts and seeds and often form flocks.
Meerkats are small social mongooses from southern Africa that forage in groups and live in burrows.
They feed on insects, small vertebrates and plants.
Moles are small, fossorial mammals adapted to digging and living underground, feeding on invertebrates.
They play roles in soil aeration and ecosystem engineering.
Manatees are large, slow-moving herbivorous marine mammals found in warm coastal waters and rivers.
They graze on aquatic vegetation and are gentle, long-lived animals.
Mongooses are small carnivorous mammals known for agility and, in some species, ability to confront venomous snakes.
They are found in Africa, Asia and southern Europe and feed on small animals and eggs.
